brief.brief: Service Manager supports a complete set of business data processing functions.
A function always returns a value.

detail.detail: The axis function returns a string with the boundaries for a bar or point plot graph.
The cleanup function frees the storage associated with a variable.
The contents function returns a structure containing the contents of the current record in a file variable.
The copyright function returns the company copyright notice in a string.
The current.device function returns a string containing the name of the device (terminal) associated with the logged on user.
The current.format function returns a string containing the name of the current form.
The current.screen function returns an array of strings containing the screen image of the current screen.
The current.window function returns a string containing the name of the currently selected window, the one Service Manager is currently writing to and reading from.
The cursor.column function returns the number of the column on the displayed form that the cursor was in when the last interrupt key (Enter or option key) was pressed.
In this case, $c contains the numeric value of the column that the cursor was in.
In this case, $c contains the numeric value of the relative column in the window (taking into consideration horizontal scrolling).
The cursor.field.contents function returns a string containing the contents of the field on the displayed form that the cursor was in when the last interrupt key (Enter or option key) was pressed.
The cursor.field.name function returns a string containing the name of the field on the displayed form that the cursor was in when the last interrupt key (Enter or option key) was pressed.
The cursor.file name function returns the name of the file that the cursor field came from.
The cursor.line function returns the number of the line on the displayed form that the cursor was in when the last interrupt key (Enter or option key) was pressed.
In this case, $l contains the numeric value of the line the cursor was in.
In this case, $l contains the numeric value of the index of the array the cursor was in (taking into consideration vertical scrolling).
The cursor.window function returns a string containing the name of the window the cursor was in when the last interrupt key (Enter or option key) was pressed.
In this case, $l contains the numeric value of the line the cursor was in.
In this case, $l contains the numeric value of the index of the array the cursor was in (taking into consideration vertical scrolling).
